Wh- Questions Mixed.question: When do you brush your teeth?
Who watches the swimmers at the beach?
When do you go to sleep?
Why is he wearing a jacket?
Who helps you when you are sick?
Who works in a restaurant kitchen?
When do you clean your room?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Maia and her family just moved to a new house today. It was a lot of work to move, and their new house is now full of boxes. They can't wait to get settled. However, first, they decided to have their first dance party in their new home!

questions.question: When did Maia and her family move?
What did Maia and her family decide to do?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Leo went to the beach with his dad last Saturday. They brought buckets and shovels to build a sandcastle. It took them two hours, but they made the biggest sandcastle on the beach! When they were done, they went swimming in the ocean to cool off.

questions.question: Who did Leo go to the beach with?
Where did they go after building?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Emma has a pet bunny named Snowball. She feeds Snowball every morning before school. Emma loves taking care of her bunny because it makes her feel responsible. Snowball likes to hop around Emma's room and eat carrots.

questions.question: Why does Emma love taking care of her bunny?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Mom took Lily to the grocery store on Tuesday. They needed to buy fruit, bread, and juice for the week. Lily helped by scanning the items at the self-checkout. She felt like a big helper!
On a hot summer day, Noah went swimming at the pool with his brother Jake. Their mom watched from a chair nearby. Noah practiced floating on his back while Jake did cannonballs into the deep end.

questions.question: Who did Noah go swimming with?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every Sunday, Tyler helps his dad wash the car. Tyler's job is to spray the car with the hose while his dad scrubs it with soap. After they're done, the car looks shiny and clean!

questions.question: When do they wash the car?
How does Tyler help?
answers: by spraying the car with the hose

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Ava went to the dentist for a checkup yesterday. She was a little nervous at first, but the dentist was very nice. The dentist checked her teeth and said she had no cavities. Ava got a new toothbrush as a prize!

questions.question: Why was Ava nervous?
answers: she was going to the dentist

questions.question: What did Ava get as a prize?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The Martinez family had a picnic at the beach last weekend. They brought sandwiches, fruit, and lemonade. After eating, the kids played in the waves while the parents relaxed on the blanket.

questions.question: What did they bring for the picnic?
Where did they have the picnic?
What did the kids do after eating?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every Saturday, Ben takes surf lessons at the beach. His instructor, Coach Kai, teaches him how to balance on the board. After three months of practice, Ben can now ride small waves all by himself!

questions.question: When does Ben take surf lessons?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Sophie loves looking for seashells at the beach. Yesterday, she found a beautiful pink shell hiding under some rocks. She was so excited that she ran to show her grandma right away!

questions.question: Where did she find the pink shell?
Who did Sophie show the shell to?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Marcus went to the doctor for his yearly checkup. The nurse measured his height and weight first. Then the doctor listened to his heart and checked his ears. Marcus was happy to hear that he was very healthy!

questions.question: Why did Marcus go to the doctor?
How did Marcus feel about being healthy?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every Friday night, the Chen family makes homemade pizza together. Mom rolls out the dough while Dad makes the sauce. The kids get to add their favorite toppings. It's their favorite family tradition!

questions.question: When does the family make pizza?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Grandma took Lily to the aquarium for her birthday. They saw sharks, jellyfish, and colorful fish. Lily's favorite part was the touch tank where she got to feel a starfish!

questions.question: Who took Lily to the aquarium?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Before going to the beach, Mom reminded Jack to put on sunscreen. She said they needed it because it was very sunny outside. Jack rubbed the sunscreen on his arms and legs while Mom helped with his back.

questions.question: What did Mom remind Jack to put on?
Where did Jack rub the sunscreen?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every night before bed, Mia reads with her dad. They are reading a book about ocean animals. Mia's favorite chapter was about dolphins because they are so smart and playful.

questions.question: When does Mia read with her dad?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The whole family stayed at the beach until sunset. They watched the sky turn beautiful colors like orange, pink, and purple. As the sun went down over the ocean, everyone felt peaceful and happy.

questions.question: How long did the family stay at the beach?
What colors did the sky turn?
Where did the sun go down?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Olivia's job at home is to set the table for dinner. Every night, she puts out plates, cups, and napkins for everyone. She feels proud when her family sits down to eat at the table she set.

questions.question: When does Olivia set the table?
What does she put on the table?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The Wilson family brought their dog Buddy to the beach. Buddy loved playing fetch with a tennis ball. He ran through the waves to get the ball every time someone threw it!

questions.question: Who did the family bring to the beach?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: In art class, Maya painted a picture of the ocean. She used blue and green for the water and white for the waves. When she was done, she showed her painting to her mom, who loved it!

questions.question: Who did Maya show her painting to?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every Saturday, the Garcia family goes to the farmer's market. They buy fresh fruits and vegetables from local farmers. This week, they got oranges, strawberries, and cucumbers.

questions.question: When does the family go to the farmer's market?
What did they get this week?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Before lunch, Ms. Johnson reminded all the students to wash their hands. They used soap and water and scrubbed for twenty seconds. Clean hands help keep everyone healthy!

questions.question: When did they wash their hands?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: It was a windy day, perfect for flying a kite! Dad helped Ethan get his kite up in the air. The kite flew very high, and Ethan held the string tightly so it wouldn't fly away.

questions.question: Why was it a good day for flying a kite?
How high did the kite fly?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: It was Sam's birthday party on Saturday. All his friends came over to celebrate. They played games, opened presents, and ate pizza with fruit salad for lunch.
Grandma has a vegetable garden in her backyard. Zoe helps her water the plants and pull weeds every weekend. This summer, they are growing tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers.

questions.question: What does Zoe do in the garden?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Every night before bed, Ava brushes her teeth for two minutes. She uses a timer to make sure she brushes long enough. After brushing, she flosses and rinses with mouthwash.

questions.question: When does Ava brush her teeth?
What does she do after brushing?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The family went for a walk on the beach trail. They saw pelicans, seagulls, and even a little crab! Mom brought binoculars so they could see the birds up close.
Mom and the kids made smoothies for breakfast. They put bananas, strawberries, and yogurt in the blender. Mom pressed the button because only grown-ups can use the blender.

questions.question: Why did Mom press the button?
answers: only grown-ups can use the blender

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The lifeguard sits in a tall tower at the beach. His job is to watch all the swimmers and keep them safe. If someone needs help, he blows his whistle and goes to rescue them.

questions.question: What is the lifeguard's job?
answers: watch swimmers and keep them safe

questions.question: What does he do if someone needs help?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: Owen has a pet fish named Bubbles. He feeds Bubbles every morning before school. Every week, Owen helps his dad clean the fish tank so Bubbles stays healthy and happy.

questions.question: When does Owen feed his fish?
Who helps Owen clean the tank?

Wh- Questions Short Stories.story: The night before the beach trip, the family packed everything they needed. Mom made sandwiches and put them in the cooler. The kids packed towels, sunscreen, and their favorite beach toys.

What is the bird sitting in?
